flixel.system.input.mouse.FlxMouse

type
class
extends
flixel.util.FlxPoint
implements
flixel.system.input.IFlxInput
This class helps contain and track the mouse pointer in your game. Automatically accounts for parallax scrolling, etc.

Constructor

new(CursorContainer : flash.display.Sprite)
Constructor.

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

cursorContainer : flash.display.Sprite

A display container for the mouse cursor. This container is a child of FlxGame and sits at the right "height".

justPressed(accessor,null) : Bool

Check to see if the mouse was just pressed.

justReleased(accessor,null) : Bool

Check to see if the mouse was just released.

pressed(accessor,null) : Bool

Check to see if the mouse is pressed.

screenX : Int

Current X position of the mouse pointer on the screen.

screenY : Int

Current Y position of the mouse pointer on the screen.

useSystemCursor(default,accessor) : Bool

Tells flixel to use the default system mouse cursor instead of custom Flixel mouse cursors.

visible(accessor,null) : Bool

Property to check if the cursor is visible or not.

wheel : Int

Current "delta" value of mouse wheel. If the wheel was just scrolled up, it will have a positive value. If it was just scrolled down, it will have a negative value. If it wasn't just scroll this frame, it will be 0.

x(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint

y(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint

destroy() : Void

overrides flixel.util.FlxPoint
Clean up memory.

inline distanceTo(AnotherPoint : FlxPoint) : Float

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint
parameters
AnotherPoint A FlxPoint object to calculate the distance to.
returns
The distance between the two points as a Float.
Calculate the distance to another point.

getScreenPosition(?Camera : flixel.FlxCamera, ?point : flixel.util.FlxPoint) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

parameters
Camera If unspecified, first/main global camera is used instead.
point An existing point object to store the results (if you don't want a new one created).
returns
The mouse's location in screen space.
Fetch the screen position of the mouse on any given camera. NOTE: Mouse.screenX and Mouse.screenY also store the screen position of the mouse cursor on the main camera.

getWorldPosition(?Camera : flixel.FlxCamera, ?point : flixel.util.FlxPoint) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

parameters
Camera If unspecified, first/main global camera is used instead.
point An existing point object to store the results (if you don't want a new one created).
returns
The mouse's location in world space.
Fetch the world position of the mouse on any given camera. NOTE: Mouse.x and Mouse.y also store the world position of the mouse cursor on the main camera.

inline hide() : Void

Hides the mouse cursor

inline inCoords(RectX : Float, RectY : Float, RectWidth : Float, RectHeight : Float) : Bool

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint
parameters
RectX The X value of the region to test within
RectY The Y value of the region to test within
RectWidth The width of the region to test within
RectHeight The height of the region to test within
returns
True if the point is within the region, otherwise false
Returns true if this point is within the given rectangular block

inline inFlxRect(Rect : FlxRect) : Bool

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint
parameters
Rect The FlxRect to test within
returns
True if pointX/pointY is within the FlxRect, otherwise false
Returns true if this point is within the given rectangular block

load(?Graphic : Dynamic, ?Scale : Float, ?XOffset : Int, ?YOffset : Int) : Void

parameters
Graphic The image you want to use for the cursor.
Scale Change the size of the cursor.
XOffset The number of pixels between the mouse's screen position and the graphic's top left corner.
YOffset The number of pixels between the mouse's screen position and the graphic's top left corner.
Load a new mouse cursor graphic

inline onFocus() : Void

Called from the main Event.ACTIVATE is dispatched in FlxGame

inline onFocusLost() : Void

Called from the main Event.DEACTIVATE is dispatched in FlxGame

playback(Record : flixel.system.replay.MouseRecord) : Void

parameters
KeyStates Array of data about key states.
Part of the keystroke recording system. Takes data about key presses and sets it into array.

record() : flixel.system.replay.MouseRecord

returns
An array of key state data. Null if there is no data.
If the mouse changed state or is pressed, return that info now

inline registerNativeCursor(Name : String, CursorData : flash.ui.MouseCursorData) : Void

parameters
Name The ID name used for the cursor
CursorData MouseCursorData contains the bitmap, hotspot etc
Shortcut to register a Native cursor for > Flash 10.2

reset() : Void

Resets the just pressed/just released flags and sets mouse to not pressed.

set(?X : Float, ?Y : Float) : FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint
parameters
X The X-coordinate of the point in space.
Y The Y-coordinate of the point in space.
Set the coordinates of this point object.

setNativeCursor(Name : String) : Void

parameters
Name The name ID used when registered
Set a Native cursor that has been registered by Name Warning, you need to use registerNativeCursor before you use it here

setSimpleNativeCursorData(Name : String, CursorBitmap : flash.display.BitmapData) : flash.ui.MouseCursorData

parameters
Name The ID name used for the cursor
CursorData MouseCursorData contains the bitmap, hotspot etc
Shortcut to create and set a simple MouseCursorData

show(?Graphic : Dynamic, ?Scale : Float, ?XOffset : Int, ?YOffset : Int) : Void

parameters
Graphic The image you want to use for the cursor.
Scale Change the size of the cursor. Default = 1, or native size. 2 = 2x as big, 0.5 = half size, etc.
XOffset The number of pixels between the mouse's screen position and the graphic's top left corner.
YOffset The number of pixels between the mouse's screen position and the graphic's top left corner.
Either show an existing cursor or load a new one.

toString() : String

inherited from flixel.util.FlxPoint
Convert object to readable string name. Useful for debugging, save games, etc.

unload() : Void

Unload the current cursor graphic. If the current cursor is visible, then the default system cursor is loaded up to replace the old one.

update() : Void

parameters
X The current X position of the mouse in the window.
Y The current Y position of the mouse in the window.
Called by the internal game loop to update the mouse pointer's position in the game world. Also updates the just pressed/just released flags.
